tasks.title: Codebase Analysis and Technology Detection
tasks.description: Identify technology stack and project structure
tasks.details:
Analyse the codebase in the /app directory:

1. Identify the technology stack:
   - Programming language(s) and versions
   - Frameworks and libraries used
   - Build tools (Maven, Gradle, npm, etc.)
   - Database technology
   - Frontend technology (if any)

2. Project structure:
   - Module organisation
   - Package/namespace conventions
   - Key directories and their purposes

3. Configuration files:
   - Build configuration
   - Dependency management
   - Application configuration

4. Initial statistics:
   - Total files by type
   - Lines of code
   - Module count

5. Create a technology profile

Save comprehensive analysis to: docs/analysis/codebase-overview.md
tasks.testStrategy: Verify all technology components are identified and documented. Output file: docs/analysis/codebase-overview.md

tasks.title: Component Inventory
tasks.description: Create detailed inventory of all components
tasks.details:
Create a comprehensive component inventory:

1. Based on the technology detected, identify all components:
   - For Java: Classes, interfaces, enums, annotations
   - For .NET: Classes, interfaces, structs, delegates
   - For any: Controllers, services, models, utilities

2. Categorise by architectural role:
   - Presentation/UI components
   - Business logic components
   - Data access components
   - Utility/helper components
   - Configuration components

3. For each component document:
   - Full name and namespace/package
   - File location
   - Type and role
   - Key dependencies
   - Annotations/attributes
   - Primary responsibility

4. Create summary statistics

5. Identify entry points

Save to: docs/analysis/component-inventory.md
tasks.testStrategy: Verify complete component listing with proper categorisation. Output file: docs/analysis/component-inventory.md

tasks.title: Architecture Analysis
tasks.details:
Analyse and document the system architecture:

1. Identify architectural style:
   - Monolithic, microservices, modular
   - Layered, hexagonal, event-driven
   - Client-server, n-tier

2. Document layers/tiers:
   - Presentation layer components
   - Business logic layer
   - Data access layer
   - Integration layer

3. Identify design patterns:
   - Creational patterns
   - Structural patterns
   - Behavioural patterns
   - Architecture patterns

4. Dependencies and coupling:
   - Inter-module dependencies
   - External dependencies
   - Coupling analysis

5. Create architecture diagram showing:
   - Major components
   - Data flow
   - Integration points

6. VALIDATION STEPS:
   - Verify diagram syntax is valid Mermaid
   - Ensure all components in analysis appear in diagram
   - Add proper labels and descriptions
   - Test render with: mmdc -i docs/diagrams/system-architecture.mmd -o /tmp/test.png
   - Update references in architecture-analysis.md

Save documentation to: docs/architecture/architecture-analysis.md
Save diagram to: docs/diagrams/system-architecture.mmd
tasks.testStrategy: Validate Mermaid diagram syntax and ensure all architectural components are documented. Output files: docs/architecture/architecture-analysis.md, docs/diagrams/system-architecture.mmd

tasks.title: API and Interface Documentation
tasks.description: Document all APIs and external interfaces
tasks.details:
Document all APIs and interfaces:

1. Identify API types:
   - REST APIs
   - SOAP services
   - GraphQL endpoints
   - RPC interfaces
   - Message queues
   - Event streams

2. For each API endpoint/operation:
   - URL/Address pattern
   - Method/Operation name
   - Input parameters/schema
   - Output format/schema
   - Authentication requirements
   - Error responses

3. Internal interfaces:
   - Service interfaces
   - Repository interfaces
   - Plugin interfaces

4. Integration points:
   - External system connections
   - Database connections
   - Third-party services

5. Create API catalogue

Save to: docs/api/api-documentation.md
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure all APIs are documented with complete endpoint information. Output file: docs/api/api-documentation.md

tasks.title: Data Model Analysis
tasks.details:
Analyse and document the data model:

1. Identify data storage:
   - Database type and version
   - ORM/Data access technology
   - File-based storage
   - Cache systems

2. Document entities/tables:
   - Name and purpose
   - Fields/columns with types
   - Primary keys
   - Indexes
   - Constraints

3. Relationships:
   - Foreign keys
   - Association types (1:1, 1:N, M:N)
   - Cascade rules

4. Data access patterns:
   - Repository/DAO methods
   - Query patterns
   - Transaction boundaries

5. Create ER diagram

6. VALIDATION: After creating the ER diagram:
   - Verify Mermaid syntax is correct
   - Include all entities from the analysis
   - Show relationships with proper cardinality
   - Add clear labels and descriptions
   - Reference the diagram in data-model-analysis.md

Save documentation to: docs/data-models/data-model-analysis.md
Save ER diagram to: docs/diagrams/er-diagram.mmd
tasks.testStrategy: Validate ER diagram Mermaid syntax and ensure all entities are documented. Output files: docs/data-models/data-model-analysis.md, docs/diagrams/er-diagram.mmd

tasks.title: Domain Boundaries and Strangler Fig Analysis
tasks.description: Identify domains for strangler fig extraction
tasks.details:
Identify domain boundaries for strangler fig pattern implementation:

1. Domain Discovery:
   - Analyse package/namespace organisation for natural boundaries
   - Identify clusters of related database tables
   - Group related API endpoints
   - Find cohesive business capabilities
   - Look for team ownership patterns

2. For Each Domain Found:
   - Name and core business purpose
   - Key entities and aggregates
   - Primary operations/use cases
   - Database tables used
   - API endpoints
   - Dependencies on other domains

3. Coupling Assessment:
   - Rate coupling level (High/Medium/Low)
   - Identify database joins across domains
   - Find shared transactions
   - Locate tight code dependencies

4. Extraction Difficulty:
   Rate each domain as Easy/Medium/Hard based on:
   - Isolation level
   - Data entanglement  
   - UI complexity
   - Business criticality

5. Recommended Extraction Order:
   - Start with least coupled domains
   - Prioritise high business value
   - Consider team readiness
   - Identify quick wins

6. For Each Domain - Extraction Strategy:
   - Extraction pattern (API Gateway, Event Interception, Database View, etc.)
   - Data synchronisation approach
   - API facade design
   - Gradual migration steps
   - Rollback strategy

7. Anti-Corruption Layer Design:
   - Interface definitions between legacy and new
   - Data transformation requirements
   - Event translation needs
   - Temporary dual-write strategies

8. Create domain diagrams:
   - Domain boundary diagram
   - Domain dependency graph
   - Extraction sequence timeline

9. VALIDATION: After creating diagrams:
   - Verify all Mermaid syntax is correct
   - Show clear domain boundaries
   - Include dependencies between domains
   - Reference all diagrams in the documentation

Save to: docs/modernisation/domain-analysis.md
Diagrams to: docs/diagrams/domain-boundaries.mmd, docs/diagrams/domain-dependencies.mmd, docs/diagrams/extraction-sequence.mmd
tasks.testStrategy: Validate all domain diagrams and ensure comprehensive extraction strategy. Output files: docs/modernisation/domain-analysis.md, multiple Mermaid diagrams

tasks.title: Business Logic and Flow Analysis
tasks.description: Extract business rules and process flows
tasks.details:
Extract and document business logic:

1. Identify major business processes:
   - User workflows
   - System processes
   - Batch operations
   - Scheduled tasks

2. For each major flow:
   - Entry point
   - Step-by-step process
   - Decision points
   - Data transformations
   - External calls
   - Error handling

3. Business rules:
   - Validation rules
   - Calculation logic
   - Business constraints
   - Authorisation rules

4. State management:
   - State machines
   - Status transitions
   - Lifecycle management

5. Create sequence diagrams for major flows

6. VALIDATION: After creating diagrams:
   - Validate all Mermaid syntax
   - Include key business processes
   - Show clear flow with decision points
   - Reference all diagrams in the documentation

Save documentation to: docs/business-logic/business-flows.md
Save diagrams to: docs/diagrams/business-flows.mmd
tasks.testStrategy: Validate sequence diagram syntax and ensure all major business flows are documented. Output files: docs/business-logic/business-flows.md, docs/diagrams/business-flows.mmd

tasks.title: Security and Authentication Analysis
tasks.details:
Analyse security implementation:

1. Authentication:
   - Authentication method (forms, JWT, OAuth, etc.)
   - User storage
   - Password policies
   - Session management

2. Authorisation:
   - Role-based access
   - Permission systems
   - Resource protection

3. Security measures:
   - Input validation
   - SQL injection prevention
   - XSS protection
   - CSRF protection

4. Sensitive data:
   - Encryption usage
   - Secure storage
   - Data masking

5. Security vulnerabilities:
   - Identified issues
   - Recommendations

Save to: docs/analysis/security-analysis.md
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure comprehensive security analysis with vulnerability assessment. Output file: docs/analysis/security-analysis.md

tasks.title: Performance and Code Quality Analysis
tasks.description: Analyse performance characteristics and code quality
tasks.details:
Analyse performance and code quality:

1. Performance characteristics:
   - Caching strategies
   - Database query patterns
   - Async operations
   - Resource pooling
   - Load handling

2. Code quality indicators:
   - Code duplication
   - Complexity hotspots
   - Long methods/classes
   - Coupling issues

3. Technical debt:
   - Deprecated usage
   - Anti-patterns
   - Missing abstractions
   - Hard-coded values

4. Testing:
   - Test coverage
   - Test types present
   - Testing patterns

5. Scalability considerations

Save to: docs/analysis/performance-quality.md
tasks.testStrategy: Document all performance bottlenecks and quality issues. Output file: docs/analysis/performance-quality.md

tasks.title: Modernisation Assessment
tasks.details:
Create modernisation assessment based on the technology stack identified:

1. Current technology assessment:
   - Version currency (how outdated)
   - EOL/deprecated technologies
   - Security vulnerabilities
   - Performance limitations

2. Modernisation opportunities:
   - Language version upgrades
   - Framework migrations
   - Architecture improvements
   - Cloud readiness

3. For the specific stack found, provide recommendations:
   - If Java EE → Spring Boot migration path
   - If .NET Framework → .NET Core/.NET 6+ path
   - If monolith → microservices considerations
   - If server-rendered → SPA/modern frontend

4. Effort estimation:
   - High-level phases
   - Complexity assessment
   - Risk factors

5. Quick wins vs long-term changes

Save to: docs/modernisation/modernisation-assessment.md
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure actionable modernisation recommendations with effort estimates. Output file: docs/modernisation/modernisation-assessment.md

tasks.title: Detailed Migration Roadmap
tasks.details:
Based on the modernisation assessment, create a detailed migration roadmap:

1. Target architecture:
   - Technology choices with rationale
   - Architecture style
   - Deployment model

2. Migration phases:
   Phase 1: Foundation
   - Environment setup
   - Tool selection
   - Pilot component selection
   
   Phase 2: Core migration
   - Data layer migration
   - Business logic migration
   - API migration
   
   Phase 3: UI modernisation
   - Frontend framework selection
   - UI component migration
   - UX improvements
   
   Phase 4: Infrastructure
   - Containerisation
   - CI/CD pipeline
   - Monitoring/logging

3. For each phase:
   - Specific tasks
   - Dependencies
   - Deliverables
   - Success criteria

4. Risk mitigation strategies

5. Create migration architecture diagram

6. VALIDATION: After creating the diagram:
   - Validate Mermaid syntax is correct
   - Show clear migration phases
   - Include both current and target state
   - Reference the diagram in the roadmap document

Save roadmap to: docs/modernisation/migration-roadmap.md
Save diagram to: docs/diagrams/target-architecture.mmd
tasks.testStrategy: Validate roadmap completeness and diagram syntax. Output files: docs/modernisation/migration-roadmap.md, docs/diagrams/target-architecture.mmd

tasks.title: Legacy to Modern Component Mapping
tasks.description: Map legacy components to modern equivalents
tasks.details:
Create detailed component mapping from legacy to modern stack:

1. Technology mapping table:
   - Legacy component/pattern → Modern equivalent
   - Migration complexity (Low/Medium/High)
   - Notes and considerations

2. Code pattern transformations:
   - Legacy patterns → Modern patterns
   - Anti-pattern remediation
   - Best practice adoption

3. Specific examples based on stack:
   - For Java EE → Spring Boot: EJB to Service, etc.
   - For .NET Framework → .NET Core: Web Forms to MVC/API
   - For legacy frontend → Modern SPA

4. Data access migration:
   - ORM changes
   - Query modernisation
   - Connection management

5. Configuration migration:
   - From XML to code/annotations
   - Environment-specific configs
   - Secrets management

Save to: docs/modernisation/component-mapping.md
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure comprehensive mapping with specific migration examples. Output file: docs/modernisation/component-mapping.md

tasks.title: Comprehensive Documentation Validation
tasks.details:
Perform comprehensive validation:

1. Run diagram validation:
   - Execute: bash scripts/validate-mermaid.sh
   - Review any syntax errors reported
   - Fix invalid diagrams

2. Check documentation completeness:
   - Verify all expected files exist
   - Search for placeholder text: [To be filled], TODO, PLACEHOLDER
   - Ensure all sections have real content

3. Validate cross-references:
   - Check all .md file links work
   - Verify diagram references are correct
   - Ensure no broken links

4. Check diagram usage:
   - Confirm all .mmd files are referenced in documentation
   - Update any missing references

5. Run comprehensive validation:
   - Execute: bash scripts/validate-all.sh
   - Review the validation report
   - Fix any critical issues

6. Final checks:
   - CLAUDE.md is complete with project-specific info
   - Executive summary is clear and concise
   - All modernisation recommendations are actionable
   - Domain extraction plan is comprehensive
   - Strangler fig strategies are practical

Report validation results and confirm all issues are resolved.
tasks.testStrategy: Run validation scripts and ensure all documentation passes validation. Output file: docs/validation/validation-summary.md

tasks.title: Update CLAUDE.md
tasks.details:
Update the CLAUDE.md file with specific guidance for this codebase:

1. Use the comprehensive template if available (CLAUDE.md.template)

2. Project Overview:
   - Brief description of what the application does
   - Technology stack summary
   - Key business domain
   - Architecture style

3. Architecture:
   - High-level architecture description
   - Main modules/components
   - Key design patterns used
   - Domain boundaries identified

4. Common Development Commands:
   - Build commands
   - Run/test commands
   - Deployment commands
   - Database setup (if applicable)

5. Key Patterns and Conventions:
   - Coding standards observed
   - Naming conventions
   - File organisation patterns
   - Important configuration files

6. Important Notes:
   - Critical business logic locations
   - Security considerations
   - Performance hotspots
   - Known issues or limitations

7. Modernisation Context:
   - Current state assessment
   - Recommended migration path
   - Key domains for extraction
   - Priority areas for modernisation

Update the existing CLAUDE.md file, replacing the placeholder sections with actual content based on the codebase analysis.

Make it concise but comprehensive enough to help Claude understand the codebase quickly.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify CLAUDE.md contains project-specific information in all sections. Output file: CLAUDE.md

tasks.title: Generate Executive Summary
tasks.details:
Create an executive summary of the documentation:

1. System Overview:
   - What the system does
   - Current technology stack
   - Architecture style
   - Size and complexity metrics

2. Key Findings:
   - Strengths of current system
   - Major issues identified
   - Technical debt assessment
   - Security concerns

3. Domain Analysis Summary:
   - Key domains identified
   - Extraction complexity
   - Recommended extraction sequence

4. Modernisation Recommendation:
   - Recommended target stack
   - Expected benefits
   - High-level approach
   - Rough timeline
   - Investment required (High/Medium/Low)

5. Strangler Fig Migration Strategy:
   - Phase 1: Quick wins (which domains)
   - Phase 2: Core domains
   - Phase 3: Complex domains
   - Anti-corruption approach

6. Risks and Mitigation:
   - Top 5 risks
   - Mitigation strategies

7. Next Steps:
   - Immediate actions
   - Planning requirements
   - Team requirements

Make it concise (2-3 pages) and suitable for executive readership.

Save to: docs/executive-summary.md
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure executive summary is concise yet comprehensive. Output file: docs/executive-summary.md
